plugins.name: Zoomies
plugins.description:
Zoomies helps you magnify and highlight specific parts of your design work. It's handy for presenting, sharing, and critiquing your designs.


To use Zoomies:

  1. Create a circle (using the ellipse tool).
  2. Place it over the area you want to magnify, at the top level of the canvas. (Hold spacebar to keep the ellipse from nesting.)
  3. With the circle selected, run the plugin.


Note that the ellipse layer must be at the highest (canvas) level. If it's nested within a frame, the plugin won't work.
plugins.tagline: Magnify your UI

plugins.name: Selection texts
plugins.description:
Controls texts on your page similar to how Selection colors work


Selection Texts groups texts in your selection based on font family, style, and size properties.

Easily view and update text properties for entire text groups at once.


How to use the plugin:


  1. Run plugin.
  2. Select an area containing at least one text layer.
  3. Click on the font name to open the font families modal.
  4. Click on the style name to open the font styles modal.
  5. Adjust font size by changing the input value.
  6. Click the target icon to select all text layers with the same text properties in your selection.
  7. Click the target icon and update other text properties in the Text panel.


Feedback and error reports for the plugin are welcome.
plugins.tagline: Controls text on your page similar to how Selection colors work

plugins.name: Push A Button
plugins.description:
Push A Button to get a button

Simplify your workflow with instant button components.


Features :

  1. Generates button components that can be used for design kit creation
  2. Buttons will generate with Auto-Layout. Hug-Content will wrap the button text with specified paddings in the plugin.
  3. Generate multiple buttons of same style without closing the plugin. Each button creation of same style will have the count number with it. For example : "Button-Primary 1" , "Button-Primary 2", .. etc.
  4. The Figma view will take you to the generated component on the canvas.
  5. Reset the plugin values with Reset button


How to Use :

  1. Open the plugin anywhere on the file
  2. Fill out the plugin fields
  3. "Push A Button" will generate the button component on the current page you're on, on the Figma file.
  4. The values in the plugin will not go away until pressed reset button. By keep pressing "Push A Button", the plugin will keep generating the button components.
  5. Reset the values, and repeat.
  6. Close the plugin from Top-Right corner.


To Note :

  1. It is mandatory to fill out all the plugin fields to generate the button. It will prompt an alert otherwise.
  2. The generated buttons currently show on same X-axis and Y-axis, so move them around to see.


Thank You for visiting the plugin. Please reach out for any feedbacks.
plugins.tagline: Push A Button to get a button

plugins.name: File Key Extractor
plugins.description:
File Key Extractor is a plugin to extract information from Figma URLs without having to do it manually. Specifically, it parses the URLs and retrieves the File Key and Node ID, allowing users to directly access specific elements and files in their Figma projects with LLMs using LangChain.


How to Use


Copy the Figma URL that you want to parse. The URL can be obtained from the browser or by clicking on the "Share" button and then selecting the "Copy Link" option.


The link should be to a file in Figma or Figjam and must come from 'figma.com'.

It would look something like: "https://www.figma.com/file/some_file_key/somename?type=design&node-id=some_node_id&mode=design&t=MvsdfdfnacmVx-1".


However, the plugin will also accept URLs without the 'https://' or 'www'.


Paste the copied URL into the input field in the plugin and click on the "Parse URL" button. The plugin will then parse the URL and display the 'File Key' and 'Node ID' in separate input fields.


Click the corresponding copy button next to each field to copy the values to your clipboard.


Note: Each time a new URL is parsed, the previous messages will disappear. If the URL entered is not from 'figma.com', an error message will be displayed.


This tool is a quick and efficient way to extract critical identifiers from your Figma URLs, saving time and reducing the potential for errors.
plugins.tagline: Extract Figma file key and node id for use with LangChain

plugins.name: Planet
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin for generating 3D-style, vector-based planets and terrain maps.

Design unique planets with adjustable sliders and randomization options. Save your favorite designs as reusable presets or explore default ones. Switch to map mode to create 2D terrain maps and apply them to your planet in planet mode.


ðŸª Features ðŸª

  1. Real-time adjustments with live preview: See your changes instantly.
  2. Custom presets: Save and manage your designs for quick reuse.
  3. Selective randomization: Toggle random variations on specific parameters.
  4. Detailed sliders: Fine-tune every aspect of your planet or map.
  5. Map mode: Generate 2D terrain maps and integrate them into your planet designs.


Tips & Tricks

ðŸŽ¨ Customizing colors

Use Figma's "Selection colors" feature in the properties panel to easily adjust the colors of your vector art.


ðŸ•” Performance optimization

Lower the "Density" or raise the "Water Level" to improve performance on slower devices. High dot density can slow down rendering.


ðŸ–¼ï¸ Page management

Avoid using more than a few vector planets on the same page. If needed, resize and export them as PNGs to save resources.


âš¡ Optimizing for slow CPUs

Minimize rendered dots and avoid using maximum settings on less powerful machines. At its peak, the plugin may generate up to 10,000 vector objects per frame.
plugins.tagline: Create unique vector planets, spheres and terrain maps in Figma

plugins.name: Toggle Spacers
plugins.description:
Toggle all your spacers with ease.


How to use this plugin:


  • Create a dedicated page for your spacer components and name it Spacers. Make sure this page only contains your spacer components and nothing else
  • Use your spacers freely, even in auto layouts (they will still occupy their space when hidden)
  • Toggle the visibility by using the Toggle Spacers â†’ All command (say via the context menu)


If you want your spacers page to be named differently you may use the the Toggle Spacers â†’ Select Page command to select a different page containing your spacers.


While similar plugins hide the actual instances of your spacer components, this plugin actually changes the components itself. This means that either all or no spacers will be visible at any given time.


The code for this plugin can be found at GitHub. Feel free to open an issue if you encounter any problems or have suggestions on how to improve the plugin.

Light DSM plugin is an engineering design system application, it works simple: â€œTreat the design as a code engineering to buildâ€


We use scientific way to abstract design specifications, provide efficient design resource management capabilities, and finally output design deliverables to developers. There will be many innovative ideas about design engineering, please look forward to it :)


We provide the ability to import icon library resources into the plugin and apply to the figma canvas in the current version.

3.  Search icon library resources from the Material Platform(material.baidu.com) (eg: Search for characters â€œlightâ€ in the search input)

4.  Click the "OK" button(bottom right corner) to import the icon resource


Icon resources are actually managed on the Material platform, DSM just call RESTful API, and the plugin supports synchronization of the icon library.


For more features, please look forward to subsequent versions.

plugins.name: Smart Chroma
plugins.description:
Smart Chroma generates a color palette based on human vision.


If you create a color palette using a generic color space, the saturation and lightness of the appearance will appear to vary simply by changing the hue. This is because the saturation and lightness of the color space do not take human vision into account. This tool allows you to instantly and easily generate a color palette that takes human vision into account.


This tool is inspired by Color Space and uses the HCT color space internally. Source code available on GitHub.
plugins.tagline: A color palette generator based on human vision.

plugins.name: Titleitos comment
plugins.description:
Titleitos: comment (Tiny)


Create titles and comments with a click of a button.

It's that simple.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select Titleitos from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a titleito!


If you select an Object / Frame and use the Titleitos plugin, the title will appear above on the y axis. If not, it will just float on your screen for fast use.


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  1. Go to System Preferences
  2. Search for Keyboard
  3. Click on Shortcuts tab
  4. Search for "App Shortcuts"
  5. Add Figma.app
  6. Click on the + and Type in: "Titleitos comment"
  7. Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+m
  8. That's it!


Enjoy!


(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)

plugins.name: Slope
plugins.description:
Introducing "Slope" - The Figma Plugin for Generating Serial Strings with Ease!


Are you tired of manually creating serial strings for your design projects? Look no further! Slope is here to revolutionize the way you generate serial strings in Figma.


Whether you're designing software interfaces, creating unique product keys, or working on any project that requires sequential identification, Slope will be your go-to solution. With its seamless integration into Figma, you'll have the power to generate custom serial strings in just a few clicks.


Here's why Slope is a game-changer:


  • Customizable Patterns: Slope provides a wide range of customizable patterns, allowing you to create serial strings that match your specific requirements. From alphanumeric combinations to specific character placements, the possibilities are endless.


  • Sequential and Random Modes: Choose between sequential and random modes based on your project's needs. Sequential mode enables you to generate serial strings in a precise order, while random mode creates unique strings at the click of a button.


Save time, eliminate errors, and boost your productivity with Slope. It's time to streamline your workflow and focus on what matters most â€“ your design. Get the Slope Figma plugin today and unlock a whole new level of convenience and efficiency.
plugins.tagline: continuous string generator

plugins.description:
Information

Generate realistic sound waves directly within Figma based on input audio files. This plugin processes audio data and creates accurate waveform visualization, making it easy to represent sound in your designs. Supports commonly used audio formats: MP4A, MP3, and WAV.


How to Use

Select desired frame and run the plugin. Sound wave should be generated within the constrains of the selected frame.


Note

This is my first plugin so feedback is much appreciated!

plugins.name: HTML to Figma by html.tofig.design â€” Import Websites, Code & AI Content
plugins.description:
html.tofig.design: Transform Websites & HTML into Editable Figma Designs


Instantly convert any live website, HTML code, CSS, or even AI-generated code into fully editable Figma designs using html.tofig.design. Stop wasting time manually recreating web elements. Our powerful tool imports webpages and code directly into Figma with all layers, text, and styles preserved and ready for you to customize.


Accelerate Your Design Workflow


Why build from scratch? html.tofig.design lets you kickstart your design process by starting with existing websites or codebases. It's the perfect solution for:


  1. Redesigning existing websites without starting from zero.
  2. Creating benchmarks or moodboards in Figma using real website elements.
  3. Performing competitive analysis directly within your design environment.
  4. Prototyping and testing variations based on live web content.
  5. Quickly grabbing needed design assets from any website.


Key Features to Boost Your Productivity:


  1. Website to Figma Conversion: Convert entire live websites into editable Figma files.
  2. Direct HTML/CSS Code Import: Paste HTML or CSS code directly into our editor and turn it into design elements.
  3. AI-Generated Code Support: Seamlessly import designs generated by AI tools.
  4. Multi-Viewport Import: Capture desktop, tablet, and mobile views simultaneously.
  5. Editable Layers: All imported elements are organized, layered, and fully editable in Figma.
  6. Preserves Styles: Maintains typography, colors, spacing, and other CSS styles.
  7. Private & Login-Protected Site Conversion: Easily import secure websites using our browser extension.
  8. Local File Import: Convert local HTML files or ZIP archives.


How to Convert a Website to Figma with html.tofig.design:


Getting started is simple:


  1. Open the plugin menu in Figma and launch html.tofig.design.
  2. Enter the website URL you want to convert.
  3. Select the viewports (desktop, mobile, tablet) you need.
  4. Click "Import" and watch your website appear in Figma!


Convert Private Websites & Local Files:


Need to import a site behind a login or work with files on your computer? Download our Chrome extension for effortless conversion of private websites. You can also use the file import option for local HTML or .ZIP files.
plugins.tagline: Convert websites, HTML/CSS, and AI-generated code into fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: Component Inventory
plugins.description:
See all your components in one place

This simple plugin allows you to see and browse all of your library components at once by creating instances of every component on a single page.


How it works?

After running the plugin it will

  1. Create a new inventory page in the current file
  2. Go through each page in the current document
  3. Find all components / component_sets
  4. Create an instance of each component on the inventory page


Benefits

  • Find components quickly
  • Audit your design system easily


Updates

26 Nov 2023

  • Added functionality to only include components a certain number of layers deep. For example if all your component exist directly on the canvas, and all your subcomponents exist in a frames called "Items" you can set the depth to 1 and it will only include the top most components. (Default functionality is unchanged)
  • To use the new features run via the cmd+P shortcut and search for "Component Inventory" and press tab to specify the search depth
plugins.tagline: See an inventory/overview of all the components in your library on a single page.

plugins.name: Figma to Bubble.io Converter - Framify.io
plugins.description:
Convert Figma to Bubble.io seamlessly with Framify.io

Convert your Figma designs into functional Bubble.io components instantly. Try out for free.


How to use this plugin?

  1. Install the free Figma plugin
  2. Design in Figma using auto-layout and save it with the plugin.
  3. Then install Framify.io Chrome Extension and open extension in Bubble.io
  4. In the Chrome Extension there you should find the converted Bubble.io components. Select and paste your converted components directly in Bubble.io.


Why use the plugin?

  1. Save hours converting Figma designs to Bubble with this plugin.
  2. Keep your design's exact look and feel
  3. Easy organization with folders
  4. Direct copy-paste to Bubble.io
  5. Free monthly usage included.


Download our Chrome Extension for additional features: Bubble.io Chrome Extension


Support: support@framify.io

plugins.name: Variables Starter
plugins.description:
Do you ever get an idea for an app/project/whatever and just want to start mocking it up? And then you end up with all sorts of random colors because you're too much in the flow to care about creating a color system? Or do you end up copy-pasting the same colors from different files over and over again?


With this plugin you can remain in the flow without worrying about setting up variables :)


What's inside

  1. Color variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Radii variables
  4. Typography variables
  5. ...and more.


Names and values are from tailwindcss.com.

Plugin demo.


Big thanks to @maxdemaio and @davestewart for contributing!

plugins.name: Fixed-Hug-Fill
plugins.description:
Tired of manually going through all your layers to make their resizing options either fixed, hug or fill? Well, worry no more!

With the Fixed-Hug-Fill Plugin you can select the outermost layer, choose your resizing style for width or height and resize through all layers with only a few clicks.


The plugin works for frames, groups and shapes. Layers with absolute positioning will be ignored.


Usage

  1. Select one or multiple frames, components or instances
  2. Start the plugin
  3. Choose the resizing option for all widths (No Changes, Fixed Width, Hug Content, Fill Container)
  4. Choose the resizing option for all heights (No Changes, Fixed Height, Hug Content, Fill Container)
  5. Press the â€œApply Changesâ€ button
plugins.tagline: Changing resizing options for all layers (fixed, hug, fill)

plugins.name: Tailwind CSS Font Size Generator
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow and save a ton of time with the Tailwind Font Size Generator plugin for Figma! This intuitive plugin allows you to seamlessly generate font sizes and font styles using the default Tailwind CSS font scale, ensuring your designs stay consistent and aligned with the popular utility-first framework.


Key Features:

  1. Tailwind Integration: Access the complete range of default Tailwind CSS font sizes directly within Figma.
  2. Consistency and Efficiency: Maintain design consistency across your projects by using standardised font sizes.
  3. Generate text styles: Automatically generates text styles for you so you don't have to do manual work. You can also select a frame and initialize the styles from it. Preferably frames generated with this plugin.
  4. Overwrite existing styles: If you have text nodes linked to a text style then overwriting the text style will apply the new styles to the linked nodes.
  5. Customisability: You can drag to reorder, add or remove styles. Rename titles. Change font size, line height and letter spacing per style.
  6. User-Friendly Interface: Easy to navigate, the plugin integrates smoothly into your Figma workspace.
  7. Real-Time Updates: Instantly apply and adjust font sizes, seeing changes in real time as you design.
  8. Copy code: Switch to dev mode to copy the styles in code for use in your tailwind.config file. Choose between the config.js (v3) or theme variables (v4) style.


As a developer you can use this package to read the Figma file and export all the styles this plugin generates into your codebase.

https://github.com/tiersept/figma-export-tailwind-font-size
plugins.tagline: Generate font sizes and font styles using the default Tailwind CSS font scale.

plugins.name: Write Layouts
plugins.description:
The plugin enables you to input AutoLayout settings using a syntax like Tailwind CSS.

It automatically sets layer names based on the AutoLayout settings, keeping your custom layer names.


The props syntax:

  • Direction: col | row | wrap
  • Justify Content: g-auto
  • Gap: g-{number}
  • Gap Vertically: gy-{number}
  • Gap Horizontally: gx-{number}
  • Padding: p-{number}
  • Padding Vertically: py-{number}
  • Padding Horizontally: px-{number}
  • Padding Top: pt-{number}
  • Padding Bottom: pb-{number}
  • Padding Left: pl-{number}
  • Padding Right: pr-{number}


Input these props separated by a space. 

When the 'Direction' prop is included, it will override all props, with any unspecified props defaulting to 0. 

When omitting the 'Direction' prop, only specific props will be overwritten.


Example:

'col g-24'

'row g-auto py-8 px-16'

'wrap gx-16 gy-32'
plugins.tagline: The plugin lets you input AutoLayout settings

60249.name: Write Layouts
60249.description:
The plugin enables you to input AutoLayout settings using a syntax like Tailwind CSS.

It automatically sets layer names based on the AutoLayout settings, keeping your custom layer names.


The props syntax:

  • Direction: col | row | wrap
  • Justify Content: g-auto
  • Gap: g-{number}
  • Gap Vertically: gy-{number}
  • Gap Horizontally: gx-{number}
  • Padding: p-{number}
  • Padding Vertically: py-{number}
  • Padding Horizontally: px-{number}
  • Padding Top: pt-{number}
  • Padding Bottom: pb-{number}
  • Padding Left: pl-{number}
  • Padding Right: pr-{number}


Input these props separated by a space. 

When the 'Direction' prop is included, it will override all props, with any unspecified props defaulting to 0. 

When omitting the 'Direction' prop, only specific props will be overwritten.


Example:

'col g-24'

'row g-auto py-8 px-16'

'wrap gx-16 gy-32'

parameters.name: Input props...
parameters.description: Type layout props (Example: 'col g-24', 'row g-auto py-8 px-16')

plugins.name: Style Setuper
plugins.description:
Meet Style Setuper, a plugin that makes setting up text and color styles a breeze. Just choose a frame and Style Setuper does the work for you. It scans the frame, figures out all the text parts, and suggests styles based on what's used the most, so your design looks put together. Same for the colors and gradients!


But that's not all â€“ Style Setuper not only gives you new styles but also finds similar ones that can be combined. By getting rid of extra styles, you keep your text and color styles neat, making sure your designs stay on track.


Style Setuper also lets you go with the suggestions, mix up similar styles, and tweak the details to fit your design style. Whether you're just starting or you're a design pro, this plugin speeds up your work and keeps your designs looking sharp.

plugins.name: Webflow favicon - by Mekaa
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin allows users to quickly and easily generate frames at the specific sizes needed for favicon icons. With a single click, users can duplicate the selected frame and resize it to two standard favicon sizes: 32x32 and 256x256. This plugin also maintains the proportions of elements inside the frame during resizing.

Features

  • Duplicates the selected frame.
  • Proportionally resizes duplicated frames to standard favicon dimensions (32x32 and 256x256).
  • Duplicated frames are placed next to the original one for easy tracking.


How to Use

  1. Install the Webflow Favicon plugin from the Figma plugin store.
  2. Select the frame you want to resize for your favicon.
  3. Go to the plugin menu and run the "Webflow Favicon" plugin.
  4. In the plugin's user interface, click the "Duplicate and resize frame" button.
  5. Your frame is then duplicated twice and proportionally resized to 32x32 and 256x256 sizes.
  6. Duplicated frames are placed next to the original frame on the canvas.

This makes the process of creating favicons a breeze, letting you focus on other aspects of your design. This plugin is free to use and made by Mekaa

plugins.name: Figma Raw: Export Design Data for AI/LLM & Agents
plugins.description:
Bridge the gap between your Figma designs and the power of AI.

Japanese below / æ—¥æœ¬èªžã¯å¾ŒåŠã«è¨˜è¼‰


Figma Raw exports detailed information about your selected Figma elements into clean, structured JSON, ready to be used with any AI/LLM tool or AI coding agent like Cursor or Devin.


ðŸš€ NEW: Export Multiple JSON Files

Export your designs as downloadable JSON files! Select a single node for a .json file, or multiple nodes for a .zip archive. Now AI agents can process entire design systems and multiple screens in one go - a game-changer for AI-powered design-to-code workflows.


Why Figma Raw?

  1. Detailed & Accurate Export: Go beyond basic layers. Figma Raw extracts component names, properties, Auto Layout settings, and crucially, resolves the exact names of your Figma Variables (design tokens) and Text Styles.
  2. Seamless AI Integration: Copy the generated JSON (Pretty or Minified), export as files, or paste directly into your AI tool's prompt. Accelerate code generation, design analysis, documentation, and more.
  3. Design System Aware: Because Figma Raw includes the precise names from your design system (e.g., colors/primary/500, typography/body-large), you can instruct AI to generate code that perfectly aligns with your existing system, ensuring consistency.
  4. Generic & Future-Proof: This is a universal solution. Export once and use the JSON data across various LLMs and AI agents without being locked into a specific platform.
  5. Empower AI Agents: Provide AI agents like Cursor or Devin with the rich, structured design context they need to generate accurate, production-ready code directly from your Figma designs. With file export, agents can now process multiple designs automatically.


How it Works:

  1. Select the Figma nodes (frames, components, text, etc.) you want to export.
  2. Run the "Figma Raw" plugin.
  3. Copy the JSON data (Pretty or Minified) or click "Export JSON" to download files.
  4. Use the data with your AI/LLM tool or agent.


Ideal for:

  1. Frontend Developers leveraging AI for code generation at scale.
  2. Designers seeking accurate design handoffs to AI tools.
  3. Teams aiming to maintain design system consistency in AI-assisted workflows.
  4. Users of AI coding agents (Cursor, Devin, etc.) wanting to work directly from Figma designs.
  5. Anyone building AI-powered design-to-code pipelines.

This plugin is a private project by Tokyo-based designer Yasuhiro Yokota.


---

plugins.tagline: The Universal Figma-to-JSON Bridge for Any LLM & AI Tool.

138596.name: Figma Raw: Export Design Data for AI/LLM & Agents
138596.description:
Bridge the gap between your Figma designs and the power of AI.

Japanese below / æ—¥æœ¬èªžã¯å¾ŒåŠã«è¨˜è¼‰


Figma Raw exports detailed information about your selected Figma elements into clean, structured JSON, ready to be used with any AI/LLM tool or AI coding agent like Cursor or Devin.


ðŸš€ NEW: Export Multiple JSON Files

Export your designs as downloadable JSON files! Select a single node for a .json file, or multiple nodes for a .zip archive. Now AI agents can process entire design systems and multiple screens in one go - a game-changer for AI-powered design-to-code workflows.


Why Figma Raw?

  1. Detailed & Accurate Export: Go beyond basic layers. Figma Raw extracts component names, properties, Auto Layout settings, and crucially, resolves the exact names of your Figma Variables (design tokens) and Text Styles.
  2. Seamless AI Integration: Copy the generated JSON (Pretty or Minified), export as files, or paste directly into your AI tool's prompt. Accelerate code generation, design analysis, documentation, and more.
  3. Design System Aware: Because Figma Raw includes the precise names from your design system (e.g., colors/primary/500, typography/body-large), you can instruct AI to generate code that perfectly aligns with your existing system, ensuring consistency.
  4. Generic & Future-Proof: This is a universal solution. Export once and use the JSON data across various LLMs and AI agents without being locked into a specific platform.
  5. Empower AI Agents: Provide AI agents like Cursor or Devin with the rich, structured design context they need to generate accurate, production-ready code directly from your Figma designs. With file export, agents can now process multiple designs automatically.


How it Works:

  1. Select the Figma nodes (frames, components, text, etc.) you want to export.
  2. Run the "Figma Raw" plugin.
  3. Copy the JSON data (Pretty or Minified) or click "Export JSON" to download files.
  4. Use the data with your AI/LLM tool or agent.


Ideal for:

  1. Frontend Developers leveraging AI for code generation at scale.
  2. Designers seeking accurate design handoffs to AI tools.
  3. Teams aiming to maintain design system consistency in AI-assisted workflows.
  4. Users of AI coding agents (Cursor, Devin, etc.) wanting to work directly from Figma designs.
  5. Anyone building AI-powered design-to-code pipelines.

This plugin is a private project by Tokyo-based designer Yasuhiro Yokota.

plugins.name: Image Colour Separation
plugins.description:
This plugin extracts and generates a new image based on a user-specified HEX colour channel.


1. Select a image on the Figma canvas.

2. Enter a HEX colour code or use an Eyedropper tool to specify the colour channel to extract.

5. Click the "Generate the image" button.
plugins.tagline: This plugin extracts and generates a new image based on a user-specified HEX colour channel.
